Exercise Description: Consider a polar coordinate system with a bombing target at the origin. A bomber throws a bomb hitting a distance R from the origin with the density fR(r) = re^{-(1/2)r^2}. The probability that the target will be destroyed is e^{−r^2} if the bomb hits at a distance r from the origin.
Question Text: What is the probability that the bombing target will be destroyed?
